org.apache.river.test.spec.policyprovider.dynamicPolicyProvider

Class DynamicPolicyProviderTestBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.QATestEnvironment
      • org.apache.river.test.spec.policyprovider.AbstractTestBase
        • org.apache.river.test.spec.policyprovider.dynamicPolicyProvider.DynamicPolicyProviderTestBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Test, TestEnvironment
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GetGrantsNoPrincipal, GrantNoPrincipalCase01, GrantNoPrincipalCase02, GrantPrincipal, GrantPrincipalSame, NullCases, PolicyInitializationExceptionTest, RefreshNoPrincipal, SecurityExceptionConstructor

    public abstract class DynamicPolicyProviderTestBase
extends AbstractTestBase
    This class is base class for all org.apache.river.test.spec.policyprovider.dynamicPolicyProvider tests. This class has some helper methods and constants.

        TestException - if failed

                                     Principal[] pa,
                                     Permission[] p,
                                     String msg)
                              throws TestException

        pa - principals to query dynamic grants or null.
        p - permissions do not granted earlier or null.
        msg - string to format log message.

        TestException - if failed

      • callGetPermissions

        protected void callGetPermissions(ProtectionDomain pd,
                                  Permission[] p,
                                  String msg)
                           throws TestException
        Call getPermissions() on DynamicPolicyProvider and if passing Permission[] p is not null then verify that an PermissionCollection containing p (granted earlier) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pd - the ProtectionDomain or null.
        p - permissions granted earlier or null. If the policy being tested supports revoking permissions, dynamically granted permissions passed in must not be present, as this will remove the ability to revoke the permissions as they will become merged into the PermissionDomain's cached PermissionCollection.
        msg - string to format log message.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

      • callGetPermissions

        protected void callGetPermissions(CodeSource cs,
                                  Permission[] p,
                                  boolean dynamicallyGranted,
                                  String msg)
                           throws TestException
        Call getPermissions() on DynamicPolicyProvider and if passing Permission[] p is not null then verify that an PermissionCollection containing p (granted earlier) is returned.
        Parameters:
        cs - the CodeSource or null.
        p - permissions granted earlier or null.
        msg - string to format log message.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

                                    throws TestException

                           Permission pm,
                           boolean exp,
                           String msg)
                    throws TestException

        Parameters:
        pd - the ProtectionDomain or null.
        pm - permission granted earlier or null.
        exp - expected result.
        msg - string to format log message.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

      • checkImplies

        protected void checkImplies(ProtectionDomain pd,
                            Permission[] pma,
                            boolean expected,
                            boolean ifNull)
                     throws TestException
        Call implies() on ProtectionDomain passing Permission[].
        Parameters:
        pd - the ProtectionDomain or null.
        pma - permissions granted earlier or null.
        expected - expected result.
        ifNull - then expected result should be false for null ProtectionDomain.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

      • checkGrant

        protected void checkGrant(Class[] classes,
                          Permission[] pma,
                          boolean expectSecurityException)
                   throws TestException
        Iterates over array of classes and call grant() on DynamicPolicyProvider passing null as Principal[] and various arrays of Permission[]. Arrays of Permission[] will be created as sequential arrays from first element of Permission[] pma parameter to last element of Permission[] pma parameter. Verify that SecurityException is thrown if expectSecurityException is true.
        Parameters:
        classes - array of classes.
        pma - permissions to be granted.
        expectSecurityException - if true verify that SecurityException is thrown.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

      • checkGrant

        protected void checkGrant(Class[] classes,
                          Principal[] pa,
                          Permission[] pma,
                          boolean expectSecurityException)
                   throws TestException
        Iterates over array of classes and call grant() on DynamicPolicyProvider passing array of Principals and various arrays of Permissions. Arrays of Permissions will be created as sequential arrays from first element of Permission[] pma parameter to last element of Permission[] pma parameter. Verify that SecurityException is thrown if expectSecurityException is true.
        Parameters:
        classes - array of classes.
        pa - principals to be granted.
        pma - permissions to be granted.
        expectSecurityException - if true verify that SecurityException is thrown.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed

      • checkGetGrants

        protected void checkGetGrants(Class[] classes,
                              Principal[] pra,
                              Permission[] pma)
                       throws TestException
        Iterates over array of classes and call getGrants() on DynamicPolicyProvider passing Principal[] pra array. Check that returned array contains the same permissions as Permission[] pma parameter.
        Parameters:
        classes - array of classes.
        pra - principals to query dynamic grants or null.
        pma - permissions to be checked or null.
        Throws:
        TestException - if failed
